active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the balance between strict Email DLP controls for protecting PII/PHI/PCI/IP and potential impacts on employee productivity and privacy. Use NIST SP 800-53 controls as reference. Consider real-world stats: Email is involved in 90%+ of data breaches (e.g., Verizon DBIR insights).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate high-quality flashcards for the topic 'Email DLP Controls' in the hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Data Security Controls > Data Loss Prevention (DLP) > DLP Technology Implementation > Email DLP Controls. Incorporate these exactly: - Learning Objectives: [PASTE FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: [PASTE FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding: [PASTE FULL 4 LAYERS FROM ABOVE] - Big Picture: Email DLP prevents 90%+ breaches (Verizon DBIR); balances security/productivity. - Prerequisites: Data classification, general DLP, email security. - Standards: NIST SP 800-53, SP 800-177 Rev. 1 (Trustworthy Email), ACSC ISM (email encryption/scanning). - Key Content: Data types (PII/PHI/PCI/IP/Financial), DLP types (Network/Endpoint/Cloud), implementation steps, threats (phishing/insider). Use the Flashcard Schema exactly: Output ONLY a JSON array of 40-50 flashcards. Balance by Bloom's/scaffolding. For MCQs, include 3 distractors per protocol. Tie each to objectives/activities/layers. Ensure explanations promote active recall and misconceptions correction. No extra text.
